subject: Parenting
title: Swaddling Through the Ages
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Swaddling Through the Ages.

hook.text: Medieval babies were wrapped so tightly in cloth they couldn't move a limb. For months.

buildup.text: Swaddling has been practiced for thousands of years across nearly every culture.

discovery.text: Historical reasons included warmth, convenience, and the belief that loose limbs would grow crooked.

twist.text: Extreme medieval swaddling â€” boards and bindings â€” actually delayed motor development.

climax.text: Modern gentle swaddling calms newborns and improves sleep, but tight binding is now recognized as harmful.

punchline.text: The idea survived. The method evolved. Context always matters.

quiz.question: Why did medieval Europeans swaddle babies so tightly?
